The script run_analysis.R reads "Human activity data recorded by smart phones" from this source (http://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Human+Activity+Recognition+Using+Smartphones) and creates a tidy summarized data out of the experiment data.


### About the data:

The data set contains observations from experiments conducted in Smartlab - Non Linear Complex Systems Laboratory DITEN - UniversitÃ  degli Studi di Genova. The experiments were carried out with a group of 30 volunteers, each person performing six activities (WALKING, WALKING_UPSTAIRS, WALKING_DOWNSTAIRS, SITTING, STANDING, LAYING) wearing a smartphone (Samsung Galaxy S II) on the waist. Using embedded accelerometer and gyroscope, 3-axial linear acceleration and 3-axial angular velocity were recorded. 


### The original data has the following files:
>
1. features.txt - Has 561 variables of each feature vector 
2. activity labels - Has 6 activity types during which the observations were made
3. test data set - contains 30% volunteer data.
   + subject_test - 2947 observations - contains a column of numerical identifiers 
                                      that uniquely identifies a subject/participant.
   + x_test - (2947 rows, 561 columns)- contains values for all 561 feature variables observed
   + y_test - (2947 rows, 1 columns)  - contains list of activity labels from test dataset
4. train data set - contains 70% volunteer data
   + subject_train - 7352  observations - contains a column of numerical identifiers 
                                      that uniquely identifies a subject/participant.
   + x_train - (7352  rows, 561 columns)- contains values for all 561 feature variables observed
   + y_train - (7352  rows, 1 columns)  - contains list of activity labels from test dataset


### Tidy Data
The tidy data set obtained from merging the train and test datasets provides average of each variable for each activity and each subject. It has a total of 180 rows (30 volunteers*6 activity) with 88 columns of aggregated observations. Final columns names are:
